pull.title: cmake, qt: Use absolute paths for includes in MOC-generated files
pull.body:
Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31145.

From the `moc --help` output:
```
  -p <path>                         Path prefix for included file.
```

verification.payload:
tree 985ec3093218026ae2e7f1d636f3e7ef96507948
parent 2638fdb4f934be96b7c798dbac38ea5ab8a6374a
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1732461254 +0000
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1732461254 +0000

cmake, qt: Use absolute paths for includes in MOC-generated files

This change resolves build issues that occur when the source or build
directory is symlinked.

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

Tested `-DBUILD_GUI=ON` builds:
- make + whole sourcedir in symlink â†’ works
- ninja + whole sourcedir in symlink â†’ works
- make + build directory is symlink â†’ works
- ninja + build directory is symlink â†’ works

Tested ACK 6f4128e3a838d03f46d397c15bc5333287e14863

tACK 6f4128e3a838d03f46d397c15bc5333287e14863

Tested building using a symlinked build dir using Ninja. Failures I experienced in #31145 build successfully with this patch.

See #31050, this doesn't fix the scenario where the whole source dir is a symlink for me on macOS 13.7. But it's good that it does fix other things.

Maybe something in depends needs a similar change?
